Title: DH17070 - Lifting Equipment Maintenance and Servicing
Description:
The works that form this contract will be undertaken on a scheduled basis for servicing work and on demand for day to day maintenance to lifting equipment installed in domestic housing stock, sheltered housing complex and public buildings managed by the Company.
    The work required to be undertaken under the terms of this contract are as follows:
    24 hour maintenance, servicing and safety checking of stair lifts, ceiling track hoists, through the floor lifts, step lifts, rise and fall baths, passenger lifts and platform lifts
    No warranty is given to the Bidder (Contractor upon award of the Contract) by the Client as to the amount (if any) or nature of the work which may be required to be carried out by the Contractor during the agreement period and no claim for compensation either contractual or otherwise will be accepted in respect of any variation in the volume of the work.

Title: Chesterfield Borough Council - Refurbishment of the Passenger lift at Tapton Innovation Centre
Description:
Chesterfield Borough Council ("the Authority") is issuing this invitation to tender ("ITT") in connection with the competitive procurement of a refurbishment of passenger lift at Tapton Innovation Centre Chesterfield S41 0TZ.
Tapton Innovation Centre is a business enterprise centre comprising of a two storey multi occupied building with a variety of SME's conference facilities and reception. The centre is a busy commercial centre with approx.100 staff within the building. The project is to refurbish and upgrade the existing passenger lift Refurbishment and upgrade of passenger lift, including options for cosmetic upgrades to car interior and exterior landing entrances.
How to Express Interest in this Tender: 

1. Register your company on the eSourcing portal (this is only required once) - Browse to the eSourcing Portal: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/noecpc and click the link to register - Enter your correct business and user details - Note: your username will be the email address you have entered - you will also then shortly receive an email confirmation. 
2. Once registered access the site and from the Home page hover over "Tenders" on the tool bar  and select "current tenders" from the drop down options
3. Express Interest in the tender you are interested in - Select `Express Interest` within the Tender Details ( located at the bottom of the synopsis).  On doing so, you will instantly have access to the Tender Management area for that tender.  Any available documentation will be available via the various relevant tabs.  You can access this area at any point by logging in, navigating to `My Tenders` and selecting `View Details`.
4. Responding to the tender - There will be a tab allocated to any tender stage (e.g. SQ and/or ITT).  Under the `My Tender Return` area, you will be required to complete any mandatory questionnaires and upload any requested documentation. You can now use the `Correspondence` function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification (any clarifications will be found within the `Clarifications` tab). - Note the deadline for completion, then follow the onscreen instructions to complete and submit your response. - There may be a mixture of online and offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available). 
You must then submit your reply using the `Submit Return` button at the bottom of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the In-tend Support Desk.  Alerts will be sent to your request email addresses when any correspondence, alterations or clarifications are issued.

Title: 364_18 Stairlifts, Steplifts, Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Homelifts) and Ceiling Track Hoists.
Description:
Supply, installation, service, testing, maintenance and storage of stairlifts, steplifts, vertical through floor lifts and ceiling track hoists.  National supply of new equipment (including service and maintenance under warranty), regional provision of service, testing and maintenance for existing equipment.  Customer specific requirements for Rutland, Leicestershire County Council and the "Light Bulb Project" managed by Blaby District Council.

Lot No 1: Stairlifts - straight, curved and perch
Lot No 2: Steplifts and inclined platform lifts
Lot No 3: Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Homelifts)
Lot No 4: Ceiling Track Hoists
Lot No 5: Service and Maintenance Stairlifts, Steplifts, Vertical Through Floor Lifts (domestic use)
Lot No 6: Service and Maintenance Ceiling Track Hoists
Lot No 7: Discount off list for Framework items not specifically listed
Lot No 8: Stairlifts - straight, curved and perch (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 9: Steplifts and inclined platform lifts (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 10: Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Homelifts) (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 11: Ceiling Track Hoists (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 12: Service and Maintenance Stairlifts, Steplifts, Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Homelifts) and Ceiling Track Hoists (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 14: Discount off list for Framework items not specifically listed (Leicestershire CC & Blaby DC)
Lot No 15: Stairlifts - straight, curved and perch Rutland CC
Lot No 16: Steplifts and inclined platform lifts Rutland CC
Lot No 17: Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Homelifts) Rutland CC
Lot No 18: Ceiling Track Hoists Rutland CC
Lot No 19: Service and Maintenance Stairlifts, Steplifts, Vertical Through Floor Lifts (Home use) Rutland CC
Lot No 20: Service, Testing and Maintenance, Storage, Refitting and Refurbishment Ceiling Track Hoists Rutland CC
Lot No 21: Discount off list for Framework items not specifically listed Rutland CC

The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months.  The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

Title: Tender for the Supply and Installation of Lifts and Lifting Equipment to Domestic Properties - AWARD
Description:
Tender for the Supply and Installation of Lifts and Lifting Equipment to Domestic Properties
      
      Sandwell is a Metropolitan Borough Council (SMBC) in the Black Country, which is made up of six towns - Oldbury, Rowley Regis, Smethwick, Tipton, Wednesbury and West Bromwich.
      
      This framework is for the Supply and Fit of Lifts which includes: Stair Lifts (Curved and Straight), Through Floor Vertical Lifts, Hoists and Powered Lifting Platform Step Lifts (external use). 
      
      The works will be funded via Disabled Facilities Grants which Sandwell Home Improvement Agency acting as an agent of the Council is responsible for the delivery of this service across all housing tenures.
      
      The Grants assist some of the most vulnerable members of the community to live independently by adapting their homes to meet their needs. 
      Contractors will be required to carry out the entire works including: all related building work required in order to properly install the lift / lifting equipment, identify any alteration to existing services, equipment or the like, needed to be carried out in order to install the lift. To repair and decorate all surfaces disturbed by the installation to a standard to match the existing where practical and as determined by the Contracting Authority.  This is confirmed by signing the Tender Declaration & Certificate of Bone Fide Tender which is attached to this advert as part of the declarations and certificates to be completed.
      
      The successful contractors must be able to issue an NICEIC Electrical Certificate of electrical installation alterations or equivalent at the point of practical completion and ensure works are compliant with current Building and Planning Regulation Legislation. Waste should be disposed of in accordance with current legislation.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to PQQ`s / ITT`s or other related documents.
      
      In Order To View a On-Line Questionnaire (if applicable) or Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      Please be mindful that if you are cut and pasting your question responses onto the On-Line Questionnaire that you do so from a notepad document, this is due to the fact that some special characters are not accepted within the On-Line Questionnaire. 
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Wednesday 22 February 2017 at 15:00hrs

Title: NEPO Framework for the Provision of Lift, Escalator and Related Equipment Maintenance, Refurbishment and Repair
Description:
The scope of this Framework will cover the requirements of the North East Procurement Organisation for suitably qualified and experienced lift, escalator and related equipment companies to carry out the maintenance, refurbishment and repair of such equipment primarily across the North East Region. 
The types of building in which the services may be carried out includes but is not limited to the following: Education including Primary and Secondary Schools, Universities and Colleges of Further Education and Training establishments. Leisure Recreation and Culture, Health, Library, Fire, Ambulance & Police, Day-care, Nursery care, Social care, Social Housing, Assisted Housing, Elderly Homes, Specialist facilities, Transport Depots, Park and Ride, Bus Stations, Recycling facilities, Offices & other operational, industrial & commercial buildings. 
The specific projects that may be procured under this Framework cannot be clearly defined at this stage. However an indicative list of the authorities who have committed on a non-contractually binding basis to use the Framework is shown above. 
The framework will be split into lots. The lot breakdown and the minimum number of organisations that it is envisaged will be awarded against each lot is shown below: 
Lot No. 
Description 
No. of contractors on lot

Lifts and Related Equipment 
10 
2 
Escalators

Title: Personal Home Stair Lifts and Through Ceiling Lifts
Description:
The Directorate of Wellbeing Services intends to establish a 4 year framework agreement  for the supply, installation, servicing, maintenance, removal and re-installation of personal home lifts that improve the access to facilities for disabled people with sensory and mobility loss. This work will generally be carried out in private owner occupier’s households and private landlord properties.  
  
The work is divided into five “Lots”. Tenderers may bid for any or all Lots.

Title: Repairs, Maintenance, Minor and Small Capital Works (RMMSCW) Framework
Description:
Dorset County Council is seeking tenders to establish a Works and Services Framework Agreement with suitable contractors for the Repairs, Maintenance, Minor and Small Capital Works (RMMSCW) for public sector properties in the county of Dorset. Some Lots of the same Tasks are broken down into geographical areas.There are 52 Lots in total. The framework will be available to partners and the value is given as a range due to variation of requirements, demand and use by potential partners. 
Works Lots: Lots 3A to 3C, 8 & 9, 11A to 11H,12A to 12B, 13 and 14
Services Lots: Lots 1A to 1C, 2A to 2C, 4, 5, 6, 7, 10A to 10X and 15 Tender Documents available at www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk reference DN312547
Additional Text:
The requirement is primarily for Dorset County Council and partners for the repair maintenance minor and smaller capital works to public sector properties within the County of Dorset.
The Framework Agreement will be open for use by the following classes and types of user throughout the County of Dorset: Local Authority Councils (including any trading arms); Parish and Town Councils in Dorset; Schools and Educational Establishments (including Academies and colleges) http://schoolswebdirectory.co.uk/leasearch.php?lea=Dorset https://www.compare-school-performance.service.gov.uk/schools-by-type?step=default&table=schools&region=835&geographic=la&for=primary ; Police, Fire and Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services.
Hampshire County Council have requested to have optional use of this framework for Lot 14 only by exception when they are unable to fulfil their requirements through their own domestic arrangements.
Any estimated values given in this notice are given in good faith and for guidance only and the Council cannot guarantee that this value of business will be generated during the period of the framework.

Title: Home Improvement Agency Improvement Works
Description:
Fortis Living on behalf of Care & Repair Worcestershire has 4 workstream packages available under this tender: bathroom adaptations, stairlifts, access ramps and alteration/extension works.  Each workstream is split into smaller geographical areas (maximum of 13 across Worcestershire).  No level of work in quantity of jobs or value terms or geographical locations can be guaranteed, these are totally dependent on the differing six Worcestershire Local Authorities.
